intro: Anaphalis bournei, commonly known as the silverleaf cudweed, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and stream sides. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Anaphalis bournei produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
